item.title: Hide details until needed
item.description: The <details> element (also known as the disclosure element) hides content until a user chooses to view it. You can use this element to reduce the visual impact of large content blocks, such as extended source code, detailed configuration files, videos, and so on. By default, <details> hides content until the user chooses to view it. The <details> element is a core HTML element supported by many modern browsers.
